title: Appeal a driving instructor registration decision

details.description: Appeal to the transport tribunal if you disagree with a decision about your approved driving instructor (ADI) registration
details.body:
Appeal to the transport tribunal if you disagree with a decision that the approved driving instructor (ADI) registrar has made about your registration.

You can appeal against the ADI registrar’s decision to:

  • refuse to enter or keep your name on the register
  • remove your name from the register
  • refuse to give you a trainee licence
  • remove your trainee licence
  • refuse to extend your trainee licence
  • refuse you compensation if you were suspended as an ADI

How to appeal

You must appeal within a set time of getting the decision notice. The time limit is:

  • 14 days if you’re a trainee instructor appealing about a registration decision
  • 28 days if you’re an ADI appealing about a registration decision
  • 28 days if you’re appealing about a compensation claim

Download ‘T94 - Appealing to the First-tier Tribunal (Transport)’ (PDF, 207KB)

Notice of appeal form

To appeal, download the appeal form and send it to the transport tribunal.

Download ‘DSA 1 - First-tier Tribunal (Transport) notice of appeal’ (PDF, 67KB)

Download ‘Guidance notes for appellants - completing form DSA 1’ (PDF, 59KB)


The First-tier Tribunal (Transport)
7th Floor
Victory House
30-34 Kingsway
London
WC2B 6EX

There’s a different process to appeal against an ADI registration decision in Northern Ireland.
